body_html:
@shoyer I can't get your jacobian to work (seems like a similar issue to here). Here's a minimal example:

tf.reset_default_graph()

x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=[3])
y = x ** 2 / 2

jac = jacobian(y, x)

sess = tf.Session()

x_val = np.random.randn(3).astype(np.float32)

jac_val = sess.run(jac, feed_dict={x: x_val})

I get
InvalidArgumentError: TensorArray map/TensorArray_16@map/while/gradients: Could not write to TensorArray index 1 because it has already been read.

body:
@shoyer I can't get your `jacobian` to work (seems like a similar issue to [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/675#issuecomment-215130212)). Here's a minimal example:

```
tf.reset_default_graph()

x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=[3])
y = x ** 2 / 2

jac = jacobian(y, x)

sess = tf.Session()

x_val = np.random.randn(3).astype(np.float32)

jac_val = sess.run(jac, feed_dict={x: x_val})
```

I get
`InvalidArgumentError: TensorArray map/TensorArray_16@map/while/gradients: Could not write to TensorArray index 1 because it has already been read.`
